title: Powering Nashville: The Nashville Electric Service
description: Nashville Electric Service (NES) is a major public electric utility serving over 450,000 customers across Nashville and its surrounding areas. Established in 1939, NES operates under a five-member Board and plays a crucial role in delivering electricity throughout a 700 square mile service area in Middle Tennessee.
prompt: An illustration of the Nashville Electric Service headquarters, featuring a modern building with the NES logo prominently displayed. Surrounding the building, depict cityscapes of Nashville, including the iconic skyline and lush green parks. Add elements representing electricity, like power lines and light bulbs, to symbolize energy distribution, with a clear blue sky overhead to convey a sense of reliability and community service.
